Normalize rows or columns by its standard deviation.

Source: R/calc.r
normalize.Rd

Normalize rows or columns by its standard deviation.

Usage

normalize(x, normalize = 0, ...)

Arguments

x

matrix

normalize

A numeric value indicating along what direction (rows, columns) to normalize by standard deviations. 0 = none, 1= rows, 2 = columns (default is 0).

...

Not evaluated.

Value

Not yet defined TODO!

Examples

x <- matrix(sample(1:5, 20, rep = TRUE), 4)
normalize(x, 1) # normalizing rows
#>           [,1]      [,2]     [,3]     [,4]     [,5]
#> [1,] 6.7082039 4.4721360 6.708204 6.708204 6.708204
#> [2,] 3.0429031 0.6085806 1.217161 2.434322 2.434322
#> [3,] 3.2969024 1.9781414 1.318761 3.296902 1.318761
#> [4,] 0.5976143 0.5976143 2.988072 1.195229 1.792843
#> attr(,"scaled:scale")
#> [1] 0.4472136 1.6431677 1.5165751 1.6733201
normalize(x, 2) # normalizing columns
#>          [,1]     [,2]     [,3]     [,4]     [,5]
#> [1,] 1.566699 2.088932 2.121320 2.323790 3.674235
#> [2,] 2.611165 1.044466 1.414214 3.098387 4.898979
#> [3,] 2.611165 3.133398 1.414214 3.872983 2.449490
#> [4,] 0.522233 1.044466 3.535534 1.549193 3.674235
#> attr(,"scaled:scale")
#> [1] 1.9148542 0.9574271 1.4142136 1.2909944 0.8164966
